thread.title: Students Feared Dead After an Avalanche at a Japanese Ski Resort
thread.title_full: Students Feared Dead After an Avalanche at a Japanese Ski Resort

author: Joseph Hincks
title: Students Feared Dead After an Avalanche at a Japanese Ski Resort
text:
Several people believed to be high school students are feared dead after an avalanche at a ski resort in Japan’s Tochigi Prefecture Monday morning local time.
Japan’s Kyodo news agency reports that six people “appeared to show no vital signs” and a further three remained unaccounted for following an avalanche at the Nasu Onsen Family Ski Resort in the town of Nasu, 75 miles north of Tokyo. Around 50 senior high school students are believed to have been on the slope at the time — they were reportedly taking part in a climbing event.
Citing the fire department, Kyodo reports that two of the students and a teacher were also injured in the avalanche.
According to the BBC, relief efforts are ongoing and officials are investigating whether more people are missing or injured.
[ Kyodo ]
